AGAINST ALL THE ODDS.Definition: although it seemed impossible or very unlikely

MANIPULATIVE.Definition: trying to control people to their advantage

CAPABLE.Definition: having the ability to achieve things

TEMPTRESS.Definition: a woman who tried to sexually attract men

MARTYRDOM.Definition: a situation of someone's suffering or death because of their beliefs

BLADE.Definition: the flat cutting edge of a weapon

NOBLEMAN.Definition: a man of high social rank

LADY-IN-WAITING.Definition: a woman who attended or served the queen

SUITORS.Definition: people who wanted to marry her

HEIR.Definition: a son who would have his position or title after his death

SUCCESSION.Definition: the right of receiving the title or position of the previous king

ANNULLED.Definition: announced officially that was illegal or invalid

ANNULMENT.Definition: official announcement that it was not legal or valid

NULLIFICATION.Definition: the act of making it illegal or non-existent

CURSED.Definition: brought bad luck to him, damned him

ARCHBISHOP.Definition: a member of the Church with a very high rank

TA-DA.Definition: used to call attention to something important

CORONATION.Definition: a ceremony or celebration at which she was made queen

SUBJECTS.Definition: the people he was king of

WITH BATED BREATH.Definition: in a nervous and excited state

HIS EYES BEGAN TO WANDER.Definition: he started looking at other women

HAD TURNED A BLIND EYE TO IT.Definition: ignored it, pretended not to have noticed

INFIDELITY.Definition: acts of having sexual relations with other women, disloyalty

MIRACULOUSLY.Definition: in a way that was very surprising or difficult to believe

NAIL IN THE COFFIN.Definition: something that would cause her end

LOVE INTEREST.Definition: woman in whom he was interested romantically

CUNNING.Definition: clever and good at using tricks

BRING HER DOWN.Definition: make her lose her position, cause her failure

TORTURE.Definition: an act of causing extreme pain in order to make him give information

CONFESSED.Definition: admitted that he had done it

ADULTERY.Definition: having sex with someone other than her husband

INCEST.Definition: sexual activity between people who are closely related

TREASON.Definition: showing no loyalty to the king

EXECUTED.Definition: put to death as a legal punishment

EXECUTIONER.Definition: a person whose job was to kill people as legal punishment

RUMOURS.Definition: information that wasn't based on facts

WARTS.Definition: small, hard growths on the skin

DETRACTORS.Definition: the people who unfairly didn't approve of her

CHROMOSOMES.Definition: structures in the body carrying genetic information

AMBITIOUS.Definition: having a strong wish to be powerful

SEDUCING.Definition: making him feel attracted to her

PERSUADING.Definition: making him more likely to do it
